title: Emmerdale spoilers: Will Paddy make it as Chas gives birth to baby?
text:
Grabbing onto a urinal and panting with agony while Marlon Dingle (Mark Charnock) flaps about in his chef’s best attire is not the most conventional or comfortable way to go into labour (one would imagine anyway) but one thing that would really help Chas Dingle (Lucy Pargeter) is having the father of the newborn, Paddy Kirk (Dominic Brunt) there with her as they welcome the tot to the world.

After what the couple went through last time which nearly destroyed them, they have been understandably anxious about the imminent birth so the last thing Chas needed was to get trapped in the toilets.

And as he is busy trying to stop Aaron (Danny Miller) from trying to break Robert Sugden (Ryan Hawley) out of prison, Paddy has himself been locked in. Lydia Hart (Karen Blick) eventually arrived to free him from the Mill and Aaron’s own desperate situation was temporarily forgotten as he and Liv Flaherty (Isobel Steele) raced with Paddy to the Woolpack.

Advertisement

Advertisement

By the point that Paddy arrives, Chas is well on her way to welcoming the new life to the world. And they are all still waiting for Mandy (Lisa Riley) to break into the toilets with her trusty crowbar so it’s a race against time for Paddy to be there for the moment he has dreamed of.

We can’t reveal whether Paddy and Chas will be with one another when their child arrives but we can confirm that all will be okay with the new baby and, after a very stressful day, the couple unite and cradle their beloved new baby.

As they wistfully bask in happiness, they know that Grace will be so happy to meet her new sibling – but despite being exhausted, Chas isn’t forgetting her other child’s heartache as she strives to give Aaron strength ahead of Robert’s hearing.

If ever there was a supermum…

Emmerdale airs the birth on Wednesday 23rd October at 7pm on ITV.

Advertisement Advertisement
description: Paddy faces a race against time.
